title: Move referral_review_status to the top of the Referral review screen

requirements.text: Reorder the Staff/Admin Referral review screen UI so the existing `referral_review_status` field/section appears at the very top of the Referral review screen (i.e., it is the first field shown in the review form/content area, before any other referral fields/sections). Do not add any new fields, do not add or change logic, and do not change any existing data.

quotes:
Reorder the Referral review screen.

Move the existing field:
- referral_review_status

So it appears at the very top of the Referral review screen.

Do not add new fields.
Do not add logic.
Do not change existing data.

acceptanceCriteria: On the Staff/Admin Referral review UI (referral detail/review view), `referral_review_status` is displayed as the first field/section at the top of the screen/content area before any other referral fields.
No new fields are added anywhere in the Referral review UI.
No new conditional behavior, validation, mutations, queries, or backend calls are introduced as part of this change.
No backend data model, stored values, or API behavior is changed.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Frontend change only: do not add new fields, do not add/modify logic, and do not change existing data.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding the previously mentioned `next_action` field to Referral records or the Referral review screen.
Implementing backend persistence or automation for `referral_review_status`.
Changing any referral workflow status behavior, validation, or role-based access controls.
